alert.note: Alert for Iowa; Jefferson; Johnson; Keokuk; Washington (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 11 at 4:24AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Keokuk, southern Iowa, Washington, western Jefferson and southwestern Johnson Counties through 515 AM CDT... At 423 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northwest of What Cheer, or 8 miles south of Montezuma, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 45 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Strong winds could break tree limbs, knock down weak trees and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Fairfield, Washington, Sigourney, Kalona, Wellman, North English, Hedrick, Brighton, What Cheer, Richland, Delta, Maharishi Vedic City, Keswick, South English, Packwood, Parnell, Millersburg, Harper, Martinsburg and Pleasant Plain. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Stay away from flooded areas. Report any flooding to local law enforecement Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
